errors.description: This error occurs when there is a syntax error in the code. This could be due to an incorrect assignment, colon, or mismatched bracket .
This error occurs when there is an incorrect indentation. This could be caused by a lack of an indentation or one that shouldn't exist.
This error when an operation or function is applied to an object of incompatible type.
This error is caused when a local or global name is not found. This could be due to a typo or a variable that has not been defined.
This error occurs when a sequence subscript is out of range. Make sure that the index is within the bounds of the sequence.
This error occurs when a dictionary key is not found. Make sure that the key exists within the dictionary.
This error occurs when a function receives an argument of the right type but inappropriate value.
This error occurs when an attribute reference or assignment fails. Make sure that the attribute exists for the object.

This error occurs when an import statement fails to find the module definition or when a from ... import fails to find a name that is to be imported. Make sure that the module exists and is accessible.
This error occurs when a module could not be located. Make sure that the module exists and is accessible.
This occurs when the second argument of a division or modulo operation is zero. Make sure that the divisor is not zero or make sure that the divisor can not be zero.
